title: CN Level 2 â€” OSI & TCP/IP Models
concept: Layered architecture, OSI 7-layer model, TCP/IP model and mapping protocols to layers.

challenges.question: The OSI reference model has:
challenges.explanation: The OSI model defines 7 layers from Physical up to Application.

challenges.question: The TCP/IP reference model typically has:
challenges.explanation: The TCP/IP model is commonly represented with 4 layers: Link, Internet, Transport, Application.

challenges.question: In the OSI/TCP-IP models, HTTP is considered an example of a protocol at the:
challenges.explanation: HTTP is an Application layer protocol used for web communication.

challenges.question: Which of the following lists OSI layers in the correct order from bottom (closest to hardware) to top (closest to user)?

options.A: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
options.B: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
options.C: Data Link, Physical, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
options.D: Network, Data Link, Physical, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application

challenges.explanation: OSI layers from bottom to top are: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application.

challenges.question: Which service is primarily provided by the transport layer to the upper layers?
challenges.explanation: The transport layer provides logical end-to-end communication between processes on different hosts.
